- Bank of Montreal is one
of the big banks in Canada
and across North America now.
We are a 200 year plus organization,
first Canadian bank.
In today's date and age when, you know,
there are so many new players,

so it's all about meeting
your customer's demand

and the needs quicker,
faster, in a simplified way,
in an agile way, at a lower cost.

FICO is one of the leaders
in credit decision engines
and obviously a whole of America.
And we have been partnering with FICO
for a very, very long time.
So it's one of our old trusted partners,
so we wanted to continue to deepen
the relationship with them.

Right now, all our Platform
was on-prem or on-premise.
We moved it to the cloud services

through FICO's partner
solution through AWS.

- BMO is the eighth
biggest bank in Americas.
They have more than 12 million customers
and they outgrow their legacy system.
This partnership with AWS allows us

to have a real secure
environment that together
with the FICO Platform functionalities,
our intelligence on analytics,
wow, it's a win-win situation.
There is no more problems with upgrades,
no new versions, nothing, no problem,
because this is solved together
with the AWS partnership.

- From my business standpoint,
it has given us the ability

to make changes at a lower
cost, at a faster pace,
and really need not be dependent
on, you know, chain cycle and so on.
It has also given us the ability
to add additional data set,

reduce the churn of when
you're doing the data things
from a customer standpoint, as I said,

it has truly helped my
customer to meet the demand

or the need of my customer
quicker and faster.
